about: Reliability of infrastructures, DevOps, CI/CD, cloud platforms.
aboutl:
I help to make infrastructures reliable, automate deployments, and smoothen exchanges between product and infrastructure teams.

My background as a system administrator has given me a cross-sectional view of technical environments: network, security, storage, data, automation.

Today, I build on this foundation to contribute, document, share, and explore new fields, between open source, decentralized cloud, and AI.

I progress as a curious craftsman, with a taste for the concrete and ideas to share.

projets.stack: Raspberry Pi Zero, Syncthing, Linux USB gadget
projets.probleme: It’s sometimes complicated to keep data synced across different PCs, locations, platforms: desktop, laptop, work PC...
solution: An active sync key that backs up and versions important files in the background.
Detected as a classic USB data key and also as a software key.
Can connect to Wi-Fi and sync with other keys, activated by a physical button pairing.
Prototype is a Raspberry Pi Zero with Debian and gadget mode for USB detection
Multiple partitions: one for data, one for restore point, one for OS.
Data synchronization system is Syncthing.
apprentissage: UX limitations without interface
Unexplained behavior changes across PCs, even on Windows
Worked on my dev PC but randomly on others.
Idea seemed simple but each day was a new challenge
Had buyers, one paid (couldn’t refuse), others ready to buy
Found people willing to help with development, a friend assisted with brainstorming.
